result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert E Hines was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs of $3518.00 reduced to $1742.00 under the IDIP Program.  To be paid in installments of $150.00 per month commencing 06-01-2015 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.

Serve 215 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing immediately.  Under the IDIP Program, defendant to serve 90 days with 155 days stayed upon entrance into and successful completion of the IDIP Program.  After serving the first 48 hours without release, work release privileges granted.
AMENDED 11-18-2014:  Court grants 1 day credit.
Operating privileges revoked for 36 months.  Under the IDIP program, operating privileges revoked for 24 months with 12 months stayed.  Credit for any administrative suspension.

Operator's license IID effective date of application.
Vehicle IID effective 45 days of sentence date.
Submit to and comply with an alcohol assessment by the approved public treatment facility and comply with the development of a driver safety plan.  Referred to Arbor Place Inc.

Defendant found IDIP eligible.  Failure to comply with the IDIP Program will result in all stays of the sentence to be lifted.
AMENDED 05-22-2015:    Defendant successfully completed the IDIP Program.  He maintained his sobriety in the community for 6 months, completed his AODA assessment and is in compliance with his DSP, performed 150 hours of community service work and paid all required program costs.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Balance owing on PP paid in full.
Letter w/docs. ret'd from PCSD
IDIP Program Completed

Letter from Judge Duvall advising Mr. Hines successfully completed the IDIP Program.  He maintained his monitored sobriety in the community for 6 months, completed his AODA assessment and complied with his DSP, performed 150 hours of community service work and paid all required program costs.
Letter to all parties re: defendant nearing completion of IDIP contract.
1 day jail credit

Letter from Atty Loberg requesting Mr. Hines receive 1 day credit per attached booking sheet.
Court grants request, credit for one day served.
IDIP Agreement.
Associated with Charge #1 -  Original disposition didn't go electronically due to citations that were sent thru electronically from DAIT were entered incorrectly.
Count 2 Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert E Hines in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel informs court of plea negotiations.  Judge advises defendant of elements of count 1 in Information/max. penalties.  Court advises defendant of felony level prohibitions, IDIP penalties Defendant pleads guilty.  PLQ/WRF filed with the Court & reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court dismisses Count 2 & 14TR314.   Court assess fine/costs $3468 + $50 difference for felony DNA surcharge; 215 days PCJ, Revoke operating privileges 36 mos.; AA/DSP;  IID Order 2 yrs. & stay part of it on condition of entering the IDIP program.  IID Order effective 45 days from today.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on September 8, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Robert E Hines in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of elements of count 1 & 2 as stated in the Information & max. penalties; advises defendant of felony conviction penalties.   Defendant pleads not guilty.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Robert E Hines in court with attorney Lars Helmer Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint filed adding count 2.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including the right to Prelim. Hrg.  Waiver of P.H. filed with the court.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed with the court.
Defendant's Demand for discovery and inspection
Attorney Lars Loberg retained by Defendant.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
No possession or consumption of alcohol; 
No operation of motor vehicle without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Robert E Hines in court, in custody.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $500 Sign. Bond w/condition:  no drink.  Court sets $500 Sign. bond with condition:  No possession or consumption of alcohol; no operation of motor vehicle without a valid license and insurance.  Defendant agrees to waive time limits at this time to contact an atty.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
